TopicTitle: Someone pls help me with my mun-roket

Articles.Content: So I have already built a few Orbit-Rokets, and now want to go to the mun. However, I always get stability Isssues at about 7500-20000 meters. The roket just suddenly turns, as ift its top were drawn to the earth. I tried moving the SAS and installing winglets, but it didnt help. My current design is in the Attachment. I already checked the center of mass and thrust, and cant find any assymetries.

Wholey smokes! I haven\'t flown it yet but I already know what\'s wrong with it ....

edit:

a) you have WAY too much fuel and rocket to do the job. You can halve all of that and still get to the Mun. Removing rockets will reduce your thrust but it also reduces your weight. 

![B)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_cool.png) your craft is so heavy it is uncontrollable. I got it to 22000 straight up, which is more than your best, but as soon as I tried a gravity turn the beast just feel over. 

c) you have WAY too much fuel ...

d) you\'re not using symmetry in the VAB. You should be using the \'three\' setting so everything is balanced right. That\'s not causing any problems this time but it\'s a good habit to get into so you don\'t cause heartache for yourself later on.

On the plus side, interesting staging. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
thnx. I will try again with a little bit less.

You don\'t have lander legs either. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I think your fuel is right, but you are too engine heavy. See if you can drop some engines sooner. You have to wait the length of 5 LFE tanks before you can shed your first lot of engines. See if you can get rid of that sooner.
I got to the Mun with your craft pretty easily. Are you hitting T to turn on the ASAS?
Yes. But anyway, I have built a new craft already thats more stable.
